TopicTitle: New Kerbonaut, and a Thank You.

Articles.Content:
I saw this game on the steam Sale and decided to research about it.

Me being a great fan of space simulation games (regrettably there are TOO FEW of those around), it caught my attention. I eventually downloaded the cracked version it to give it a go, and man, there was only one game before that I bought literally 2 hours after I downloaded it.

The game has gigantic amounts of potential, the idea is great, the physics awesome.

Thank you. Thank you for such a good game.

Edited July 31, 2013 by Elvianoth

Welcome! That's great! Now the next best thing to do is get familiarized with a few people one in particular goes by the name Scott Manely. He has great videos on building and flying in KSP. Kurt also has good videos on KSP (he's not in .21 yet but still good). If you want to see funny stuff look for Danny. Also might want to look into getting mods. Seeing by what you posted I can assume you would like them. You may have to wait though because they are just starting to update to 0.21.

Will:

Definitely, Scott Manley is my KSP mentor, first thing I did after I tried the game for the first time was getting something to fly... didn't go well. Searched some Youtube videos and Scott has the best tutorials out there, at least my first spacecraft was a satellite that I made watching his videos

And yes, already have some mods around, specifically Kethane, Mechjeb, some "more parts" mods, and I've got a communications mod yesterday.

All in all, the game is really great, plus modding really improves gameplay by far.
